text:
Add a manual/faq/ item for how to deal with this error message:

   apache2: Could not reliably determine the server's fully qualified domain
name,    using 127.0.0.1 for ServerName

Or enhance the message to give the user a clue.
creator: jidanni@jidanni.org

text:
Hi,

This has been addressed in the HTTPD wiki pages.  Look here http://
wiki.apache.org/httpd/CouldNotDetermineServerName

This page may well be transferred to the HTTPD docs pages, but for now this 
part, or in fact most of the FAQ pages are in the wiki.

Tony
creator: tony@pc-tony.com
jidanni@jidanni.org
text:
Too bad one cannot tell the immutable wiki (unlike MediaWiki with
Talk: pages) to answer why it can't just use uname -n or
/etc/hostname, or "localhost".

Most importantly as this problem will appear on an isolated computer,
it should be shipped in the documents not requiring a network
connection to read: the FAQ (at least on Debian.)
